article_text:
BERLIN—Germany’s lower house of parliament approved a four-month extension of Greece’s bailout Friday, but the majority of “no” votes came from Chancellor Angela Merkel’s conservative bloc in a clear sign of growing impatience with the leftist government in Athens.

A total of 541 parliamentarians voted in favor of extending Greece’s €240 billion ($273 billion) rescue package until the end of June, while 32 voted against it. The majority of those voting against the extension—29 members—were from the ruling Christian...
